title: Gunman kills two and throws grenade near synagogue before fleeing
text:
Police secure the area after the shooting in the eastern German city of Halle (Picture: Reuters)

Two people have died after a gunman opened fire outside a synagogue in Germany.

Several others were injured in the attack in the eastern city of Halle this morning.

Police confirmed the fatalities and said one suspect has been arrested. They urged residents to remain vigilant.

A gunman is believed to have used a machine gun before a ‘grenade or molotov cocktail’ was also thrown into a nearby Jewish cemetery, Bild reports.

Local police said on Twitter: ‘There were several shots. The alleged perpetrators have fled with a vehicle.

‘We are searching urgently and ask citizens to remain in their homes.’

Jewish people are today celebrating Yom Kippur, the holiest day of the year in Judaism, when worshippers fast for more than 24 hours, seeking atonement.

Witnesses say the gunman was wearing military camouflage and had several weapons.

One man at the scene told reporters: ‘I heard gun shots. I saw a man with a machine gun, I think but I’m [not sure].’

When asked what the man’s face looked like, the witness said: ‘I didn’t see anything. Only that he had a machine gun and had shot a woman’

The Halle regional broadcaster said that after the suspects fled there was another shooting nearby.

People living as far away as Landsberg, 15 miles north-east of the city, were warned to stay inside.

National rail operator Deutsche Bahn said the main train station in Halle – a city of 240,000 – was closed down as a precaution.

The synagogue in the eastern city of Halle (Picture: Getty)

It comes after a series of raids were carried out last night by police in connection with threatening far-right emails sent to mosques, political parties, the media and migrant reception centres across Germany.

The raids were prompted by investigations into 23 emails sent to recipients across Germany over a two-week period in July that contained threats of bomb attacks, among other things.

The authors signed off as People’s Front, Combat 18 or Blood And Honour.

This is a breaking story we will be updating.
description: Several others are understood to be injured after the attacker opened fire with a machine gun before throwing a grenade in the city of Halle.
